chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: Capitalism is an economic structure where means of production are privately owned for profit rather than the state. Private ownership of commodities hence provides greater economic freedom without government intervention.

chapters.title: Ideology
chapters.text: Free competition and competitive pricing is encouraged as supply and demand determines production resulting in a market economy instead of command economy.

chapters.title: Production
chapters.text: Laissez-faire capitalism allows people to be unrestrained as it functions without any checks or controls. Individuals decide where to invest, what to produce and at which prices.

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: Few examples of capitalist economies include Singapore, the US and the UK.
